headline.main: Health Council Officer Urges Public-Smoking Ban; Area Could Be Set Apart A Cigar Smoker

docs.abstract: NJ Public Health Council delays putting proposed ban on smoking in public places into effect in wake of rept by retired Superior Ct Judge Sidney Goldmann calling for further clarification (M)

byline.original: By MARTIN WALDRON Special to The New York Times

keywords.value: TOBACCO, TOBACCO PRODUCTS AND SMOKERS ARTICLES
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: TRENTON, March 13--A cigarettesmoking state hearing officer, Judge Sidney Goldmann, today found a proposed ban on smoking in most public places in New Jersey to be "in order."
docs.snippet: TRENTON, March 13--A cigarettesmoking state hearing officer, Judge Sidney Goldmann, today found a proposed ban on smoking in most public places in New Jersey to be "in order."
